```{r}
#Loading in packages
library(tidyverse)
library(survival)

#Step 1- Loading in the Data
RawData <- read_csv("Data/RawData/SEERData.csv")
glimpse(RawData)

#=====================================================================================
#Step 2 - Data Cleaning
RawData_clean <- RawData %>%
  # Here I will mutate three columns to save Survival Months and Time to Treatment into Numeric values. I will also create three cases of the three different classifications of the SEER Death data. 0,1,2 Will reepresent Death due to cancer, Alive or dead because of other causes, Dead because of unknown, and the rest will be classified as 0
  mutate(
  Survival_Months = as.numeric(`Survival months`), 
  Time_to_Tx_Days = as.numeric(`Time from diagnosis to treatment in days recode`),
  Competing_Risk_Status = case_when(
      `SEER cause-specific death classification` == "Dead (attributable to this cancer dx)" ~ 1,

      `SEER cause-specific death classification` == "Alive or dead of other cause" |
      `SEER cause-specific death classification` == "Dead (missing/unknown COD)" ~ 2,
      
      TRUE ~ 0
    )
  ) %>%
  #Dropping all NAs
drop_na(Survival_Months, Time_to_Tx_Days) 
  
RawData_clean

print(glimpse(RawData_clean))



RawData_clean %>%
  pull(`SEER cause-specific death classification`) %>%
  unique()


OS_status <- RawData %>%
  mutate(
    
  )





```
